newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: INP lifts bid for NZ W&H to NZ$11/share.
newsitem.headline: INP lifts bid for NZ W&H to NZ$11/share.

text.p: Independent Press Communications, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Independent Newspapers Plc (INP), on Monday said it was increasing its bid for New Zealand's Wilson & Horton Ltd to NZ$11.00 per share from $10.50.
In a separate statement, Wilson & Horton's independent directors recommended the latest offer.
Under the new bid, the ratio of exchangeable INP shares offered as an alternative to cash is 1.375 for each Wilson & Horton share.
With 98.4 million shares on issue the higher price would cost INP just over NZ$49 million more if all shareholders accepted the cash offer.
INP already has a 22.6 percent interest in W&H, with the same amount in the hands of family trusts linked to Independent's chairman, Tony O'Reilly.
The new offer takes effect from October 10.
Its stand in the market offer would be made on an unconditional basis, it said.
The written offer was now subject only to normal conditions relating to material adverse changes to the financial and operational position of W&H prior to the close of the offer.
A 'don't sell' notice issued by the independent directors on Monday morning was lifted.
W&H is publisher of New Zealand's largest daily newspaper, The New Zealand Herald.
